description: outer carton is cream with tan stripes with dark brown "chops" on it; wooden box with inscriptions; paper under tie; fabric is grey with cream and gold accent; image on a landscape with bridge and figure in LL and building in LR with four lines of inscription in UR corner
inscription: 観樹知異心　聴鳥知殊音　日出見山高　月來見水深　風行花自動　天寒魚自沈　静者無雑念　忘跡理可尋 (Gaze at the tree and know a different heart; / listen to birds and know a different sound. / The sun comes up—you see the hills are high; / the moon arrives—you see the water\'s deep. / The wind blows—the flowers move themselves. / One serene allows no mingled thought; / forget traces, then principle can be sought.) [Jonathan Chaves]
markings: poem UR red seal: 无心 {mushin} [mushin #3]; poem LL red seals: 字曰子徳 {azana iwaku Shitoku}, 静處 {seisho} [seisho #3]
signed: 庚辰春日古道人 {kanoe-tatsu shunjitsu Kodōjin} (Spring day in 1940, Kodōjin)
title: Mountain Valley in Quiet Setting
